name: Freshman Composition I
university: University of Texas at San Antonio
learned: Developed academic writing skills with emphasis on rhetorical analysis, argument structure, and evidence-based essays.

name: Freshman Composition II
university: University of Texas at San Antonio
learned: Focused on research-based writing, integrating scholarly sources, citation practices, and sustained analytical arguments.

name: Calculus I
university: University of Texas at San Antonio
learned: Studied limits, continuity, derivatives, and applications of differentiation to physical and mathematical problems.

name: Calculus II
university: University of Texas at San Antonio
learned: Explores integration techniques, applications of integrals, sequences and series, and introductory differential equations.

name: Human Anatomy & Physiology I
learned: Examined cellular biology, tissue structure, and the integumentary, skeletal, muscular, and nervous systems.

name: Human Anatomy & Physiology II
learned: Covered cardiovascular, respiratory, digestive, endocrine, and reproductive systems with emphasis on homeostasis.

name: U.S. History to Civil War
learned: Analyzed early American history, colonial development, constitutional foundations, and causes of the Civil War.

name: U.S. History Civil War to Present
learned: Studied Reconstruction, industrialization, civil rights movements, and modern political and social developments.

name: Introduction to American Politics
university: University of Texas at San Antonio
learned: Introduces U.S. political institutions, constitutional principles, public opinion, elections, and policy-making processes.

name: General Chemistry I
university: University of Texas at San Antonio
learned: Introduced atomic structure, stoichiometry, thermochemistry, chemical bonding, and states of matter.

name: General Chemistry II
university: University of Texas at San Antonio
learned: Covers chemical kinetics, equilibrium, acids and bases, electrochemistry, and thermodynamics.

name: Introduction to Computer Programming I
university: University of Texas at San Antonio
learned: Learned foundational programming concepts including variables, control structures, functions, and computational problem-solving.

name: Physics for Scientists and Engineers I
university: University of Texas at San Antonio
learned: Introduces classical mechanics including kinematics, Newtonâ€™s laws, work and energy, momentum, and rotational motion.

name: Physics for Scientists and Engineers I Lab
university: University of Texas at San Antonio
learned: Applied experimental methods to mechanics, including data collection, uncertainty analysis, and formal lab reporting.
